title: Friday's Losses Reversed But Breakouts Remain On Hold
text:
It was a good start to the week yesterday, with Friday's losses reversed in their entirety, although trading volume was down on Friday's selling.

SOX Daily Chart

The is closest to breaking out (for a third time) but technicals are all net bullish. It just needs to kick on after the recent back-and-forth.

SPX Daily Chart

For the , most of the work was done prior to market open. The index is now less than 20 points from a breakout. On-Balance-Volume returned to a 'buy' trigger.

The is likewise set up to mark a mini-break of 8,200 before going on to challenge 8,300. It's just clinging on to its 'sell' trigger in On-Balance-Volume but this is unlikely to stay this way for long.

COMPQ Daily Chart

RUT Daily Chart

The made the best gain on the day yesterday, but it also has the most ground to make up before it can be considered to be challenging a breakout as is the case for other indices.

So, for today, focus is on whether the Semiconductor Index can finally pull away from breakout resistance. Third time could be lucky for the index.
description: Stocks Analysis by Declan Fallon covering: S&P 500, US SmallCap 2000, NASDAQ Composite, Philadelphia Semiconductor Index. Read Declan Fallon's latest article on Investing.com
